Welcome!
Thank you for taking the time to help us explore various perspectives on the competencies that should be emphasized in an undergraduate electrical and computer engineering (ECE) curriculum. Please follow the instructions that follows to complete the Q sort. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask. Thank you!

Introduction
You will be evaluating each statement based on YOUR OWN VIEWS of how competencies should be emphasized in ECE undergraduate curriculum. You will find each of the 53 statements stacked on each other. Please proceed to the instructions in steps 1 and 2 below. Each Q sort grid cell can only have one statement. Each statement is only used once.
Step 1 of 3
Step1: Quick â€œOut-of-the-gut" sort
Without-much-thinking, do a quick sort of the 53 statements into the following three general categories: AGREE DISAGREE NEUTRAL
Step 2 of 3
Step2: Meticulous or Careful Sorting is Necessary
a) Begin by sorting the statements from the right side of the Q sort grid. Place the statements you generally AGREE with into the grid, starting with your top two most aligned statements in the +6 grid cell. Then, progressively arrange the remaining statements toward the 0-column based on decreasing agreement.
b) Next, from the left side of the Q sort grid, sort the statements you DISAGREE with in a similar manner, beginning with the statements you most disagree with and working your way toward the 0 column.
c) Then, sort the statements you feel NEUTRAL about into the Q sort grid to fill the remaining grid cells.
d) Finally, adjust the placement of the statements, similar to strategizing in a board game, until you are satisfied that they accurately represent your genuine perspective and ranking priority on the topic under review.
